corresponding_assay: Cell-based TAS2R Ca²⁺ flux assay (HEK293 + Gα16)
rationale_for_deterrence: Broadly tuned bitter receptor; strong activation produces an instinctive "poison" response, especially pronounced in children.
Highly correlated with bitterness sensitivity; activation reliably causes rejection even at very low exposure.
Produces sharp, unpleasant oral sensation (sting/irritation) without heat; effective at triggering immediate withdrawal.
Mild pungency reinforces aversion but must remain below pain or panic thresholds for child safety.
